q1.question: What is YÖS exam and is it mandatory?

sections.title: What is YÖS?
sections.content: YÖS (Yabancı Uyruklu Öğrenci Sınavı) is an exam for foreign students who want to study at Turkish universities. It tests mathematics, geometry, and logical reasoning.

sections.title: Is it mandatory?
sections.content: No, YÖS is not mandatory for all universities. Many universities accept students without YÖS based on their high school grades and internal exams.

sections.title: Advantages of taking YÖS
sections.content: High YÖS scores can significantly increase your chances of getting scholarships and admission to top universities.

q2.question: Is it mandatory to take SAT or IELTS?
q2.answer: SAT and IELTS are not mandatory for most Turkish universities. However, they can be advantageous for English-taught programs and scholarship applications. Many universities conduct their own English proficiency tests or offer preparatory language courses.

q1.question: How long does the admission process take?

answer.total: The entire process typically takes 2-4 months, depending on the university and application period.

q2.question: When do universities respond?
q2.answer: Universities usually respond within 2-6 weeks after receiving complete application documents. During peak periods (May-July), the process may take longer. We recommend applying early to avoid delays.

home.q1: Is it mandatory to know Turkish for admission?
home.a1: No, knowledge of Turkish is not mandatory. Many programs are conducted in English. If your language level is insufficient, you can take a preparatory year to learn Turkish or English.
home.q2: Do I need to take YÖS or SAT for admission?
home.a2: For most programs, YÖS and SAT are not mandatory. Many universities accept students based on high school certificates and internal exams. However, having high YÖS/SAT scores can increase your chances of getting a scholarship.
home.q3: What is the cost of education and living?
home.a3: Tuition fees vary from $2,500 to $15,000 per year depending on the university and program. Dormitory accommodation: $1,500-3,000 per year. Food and other expenses: about $2,000-4,000 per year.
home.q4: What documents are needed for admission?
home.a4: Main documents: certificate with translation, passport, photos, motivation letter, medical certificate, income statement. All documents must be notarized and translated into Turkish or English.
home.a5: Yes! Various types of scholarships are available: academic (up to 75%), sports (up to 50%), early application (up to 25%). There are also government scholarships Türkiye Bursları for international students.

universities.q1: Is it mandatory to know Turkish for admission?

universities.q2: Do I need to take YÖS or SAT for admission?
universities.a2: For most programs, YÖS and SAT are not mandatory. Many universities accept students based on high school certificates and internal exams. However, having high YÖS/SAT scores can increase your chances of getting a scholarship.
universities.q3: What is the cost of education and living?
universities.a3: Tuition fees vary from $2,500 to $15,000 per year depending on the university and program. Dormitory accommodation: $1,500-3,000 per year. Food and other expenses: about $2,000-4,000 per year.
universities.q4: What documents are needed for admission?
universities.a4: Main documents: certificate with translation, passport, photos, motivation letter, medical certificate, income statement. All documents must be notarized and translated into Turkish or English.
universities.a5: Yes! Various types of scholarships are available: academic (up to 75%), sports (up to 50%), early application (up to 25%). There are also government scholarships Türkiye Bursları for international students.
universities.q6: How long does document review take?
universities.a6: Usually document review takes 2-4 weeks after submitting a complete set. During peak periods (May-July), the process can take up to 6 weeks. We recommend submitting documents as early as possible.
universities.q7: Do I need a visa to study in Turkey?
universities.a7: Yes, you need a student visa to study in Turkey. The process takes 1-3 weeks after receiving the acceptance letter. We help with preparing all visa documents.
universities.a8: International students can work part-time (up to 24 hours per week) after obtaining a work permit. This is usually possible from the second year. Many students find work in tourism or give private lessons.
universities.q9: How does the admission process work?
universities.a9: 1. Document submission online or through our representatives 2. Application review by admissions committee 3. Interview (if required) 4. Receiving acceptance letter 5. Visa processing and arrival in Turkey
universities.a10: Yes, most universities provide on-campus dormitories. We also help find private housing near the university. Dormitories have everything necessary: furniture, internet, cafeteria, laundry, 24/7 security.

reviews.q1: How long does the admission process usually take?
reviews.a1: The admission process takes 6 to 12 months depending on the chosen university and program. We recommend starting preparation a year before the planned admission.
reviews.q2: What documents are needed for admission to Turkish universities?
reviews.a2: Main documents: high school certificate or diploma with translation and apostille, language test results (YÖS, SAT or TÖMER), medical certificate, photos, passport. Full list depends on the specific university.
reviews.q3: Is it mandatory to know Turkish for admission?
reviews.a3: Not always. Many universities offer programs in English. However, knowledge of Turkish significantly expands program choices and simplifies adaptation in the country.
reviews.q4: How much do your services cost?
reviews.a4: Cost depends on the selected service package. We have basic packages from $500 to premium packages with full support. Exact cost can be learned during a free consultation.
reviews.a5: We cannot give a 100% admission guarantee as it depends on many factors. However, our success rate is 98%, and we do everything possible to achieve results.
reviews.a6: Yes, we help find and apply for various scholarships and grants. Many of our students receive partial or full scholarships from universities or the Turkish government.
reviews.a7: We continue to support students: help with visa processing, finding housing, adaptation during the first months of study. Our support doesn't end after enrollment.
reviews.q8: Can I apply without knowing English?
reviews.a8: Yes, you can apply for programs taught in Turkish. Many universities also offer preparatory language courses for students with insufficient language levels.
